repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Power Sector Rehabilitation and
            Restructuring Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Albania Power Sector
            Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. The chief lesson learned is that
            continuation of the management and operation of
            Albania's Power Corporations distribution system is too
            sensitive to political interference and may not be likely to
            solve the distribution loss and bill collection problems
            easily. As the Bank contemplates its future involvement in
            the sector it probably should: (i) design projects with more
            concrete results indicators and avoid stretched targets at
            the national levels; (ii) continue to have targets for
            performance (Action Plan) because these were very helpful to
            improve the performance of the sector; and (iii) put clear
            triggers for future engagement in the sector.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Power Sector Rehabilitation and
            Restructuring Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Sector Rehabilitation and
            Restructuring Project will significantly improve the
            operational effectiveness of the power sector, by
            implementing electricity loss reduction measures,
            introducing electricity price rationalization, and
            initiating a sector regulatory, and restructuring framework,
            aimed at establishing the preconditions for competition, and
            privatization. The project has three components: 1)
            rehabilitation, and strengthening of the transmission, and
            distribution systems in the Durrres, Elbasan, and Kucova
            regions, to improve frequent unscheduled outages, and high
            technical losses due to overloading, and outdated equipment.
            Donor-finance investments, on the basis of technical,
            economic, and environmental feasibilities carried out by
            Harza Engineering Company International, will be financed by
            the United States Trade and Development Agency; 2) provision
            and installation of secure boxes containing meters, to be
            installed in single-family dwelling units, and, secure
            collective boxes will be installed in apartment buildings.
            Additionally, remaining boxes needed for the meters financed
            under previous operations, by other donors and by the
            Albanian Power Company (KESH) will be provided, allowing the
            company to complete it metering program; and, 3) technical
            assistance will support power sector reforms, preparation of
            tender documents, assistance to KESH in environmental
            aspects, and in reviewing inventory control procedures.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Power Sector Rehabilitation and
            Restructuring Project : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Power Sector Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project
            for Albania. It describes negative environmental impacts and
            their mitigation. Polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), though
            not prohibited by law, will be controlled according to
            international standards. Noise will be reduced by site
            selection, limited to work hours, and monitored by a noise
            meter. Dust will be reduced by sprinkling water. No
            pesticides will be used. Electrical fields will be monitored
            using an electric meter, and project design and construction
            will conform to international standards to reduce any
            negative impacts caused by the electrical field.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Power Sector
            Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project : environmental
            management plan : Environmental management plan - Durres region
